Description: 8 beads made in different shapes and materials. A: One segmented cylindrical bead made of white faience. Broken off at both ends. B: Three spherical beads in different sizes, made of white faience, one with faint traces of turquoise glaze. C: One spherical bead with a protruding middle part running around the centre of the bead made of white faience. D: Three disc-shaped beads, one of them quite large made of ostrich eggshell, the other two made of white faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2Y A/B, sealed under L2 wall
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
